ETYMOLOGY: From Old French porcelaine, from Italian porcellana ('cowrie shell'), from porcella ('young sow'), diminutive of porco ('pig'). The cowrie shell's smooth, white, translucent appearance led to the name being applied to the ceramic material, or possibly the shell was used in the preparation of the material.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A hard, white, translucent ceramic material, typically made by firing kaolin and feldspar at high temperatures.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种坚硬、洁白、半透明的陶瓷材料，通常由高岭土和长石在高温下烧制而成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The artist used fine porcelain to create the intricate sculpture.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位艺术家用精美的瓷器创作了复杂的雕塑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Objects made from porcelain, especially decorative items, tableware, or sanitary fixtures.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 由瓷器制成的物品，特别是装饰品、餐具或卫生洁具。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She collected delicate porcelains from various dynasties, each with its own story.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她收藏了各个朝代精致的瓷器，每件都有自己的故事。
